recommendations: Administer CT Pulmonary Angiography (CTPA) protocol after achieving hemodynamic stability (MAP >= 65 mmHg) and implementing renal protection measures.
If hemodynamic instability persists or cannot be resolved promptly, consider a V/Q scan for pulmonary embolism evaluation.
Obtain patient's current weight and height to accurately calculate contrast volume and guide hydration protocols.
Ensure follow-up renal function tests are performed 24-48 hours post-contrast administration.
rationale: Patient's current hypotension (MAP 59 mmHg) contraindicates contrast administration due to elevated risk of contrast-induced nephropathy and hemodynamic compromise.
Moderate renal impairment (eGFR 59 mL/min/1.73m², creatinine 1.7 mg/dL) necessitates strict adherence to renal protection protocols (hydration, appropriate contrast agent choice).
Missing weight and height prevent accurate contrast dosing and personalized hydration planning.
V/Q scan is a suitable alternative for PE evaluation in patients with contraindications to contrast-enhanced CT.

protocol_selection.name: CT Pulmonary Angiography (Chest CTA for PE)
protocol_selection.description: CT angiography timed for pulmonary arterial phase (6–13 sec post-contrast) to evaluate pulmonary arteries for embolism.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Weight-based; ~100–150 mL iodinated contrast (300 mg I/mL); follow ACR Manual.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Ensure contrast-to-eGFR ratio <1.1 g/(mL/min); if eGFR <30, consider non-contrast alternatives or weigh risks carefully.

protocol_selection.name: Ventilation/Perfusion (V/Q) Scan
protocol_selection.description: Radionuclide imaging to assess for pulmonary embolism by comparing areas of ventilation with areas of perfusion.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: No iodinated contrast used; suitable for patients with impaired renal function.
